description.en: The course is focused on consumer choice, producer theory, partial and general equilibrium . The objective of the course to deepen the understanding of the technical details of modern microeconomics with emphasis on mathematical tools. Students will be assumed to be familiar with algebra, calculus including constrained optimization, and basic probability.

objectives.en: Teach students to applying microeconomic methods in real-world problems. The course will give introduction to the most popular modelling methods

learning_outcomes.en: A student who has passed the subject:
* knows the more popular ways in economics to describe preferences, production, and decision-making;
learning_outcomes.et: * tunneb kõige levinumaid viise mikroökonoomikas kuidas kirjeldada eelistusi, tootmist ja otsustamist;

learning_outcomes.en: * knows a selection of simpler widely used techniques for microeconomic modelling;
learning_outcomes.et: * tunneb valikut lihtsamates ja laiemalt kasutatavatest meetoditest mikroökonoomika modelleerimiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: * is familiar with a selection of standard models in the literature;
* can apply models, and model-based thinking in everyday situations.
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab rakendada mudeleid ja mudelite põhist mõtlemist igapäeva situatsioonides.

independent_work.et: The final grade of the course is formed as the sum of the results of four tests and four homeworks with presentations.

description.et: Four tests, each contributing 10% to the final grade.
Four homeworks with presentations, each contributing 15% to the final grade.

grade_preconditions.et: A final mark is a sum of four tests and four homeworks with presentations and there is no other specific criteria for taking exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade of the course is formed as the sum of the results of four tests and four homeworks with presentations.

The points are summed and the grade is based on the following intervals: A - 90-100% of total maximum), B - 80-90%, C - 70-80%, D - 60-70%, E - 50-60%, F - below 50%.

debt_elimination.et:
Tests cannot be retaken.
If the score for the tests falls below the 51%, a re-exam must be taken during the exam session.
